entry.title: Help Us Stop FFMP

entry.content:
"The Delaware River Basin Commission (DRBC) is scheduled to hold a vote on September 24th to amend the Water Code under which the commission operates in order to legitimize the interim Flexible Flow Management Program (FFMP) for the Upper Delaware River. Trout Unlimited urges you to visit our online action center today and tell the DRBC to postpone the vote on the Water Code until they have fully evaluated the performance of the interim FFMP and incorporated into the FFMP the changes required to ensure an ecologically healthy river system." -TU

entry.content:
The Fall is a slow time for us in general as far as the resort goes but the extra time allows me to work on the site and after thinking long and hard how I was going to improve communications with everyone I figured a blog would be the best.  The forum will still remain active for the next couple of months but then I am going to migrate everyone over to the blog so that I don't have to maintain both.

 I do want to apologize for the lack of river updates this year  Ben and I tried to  to stay on top of it but it always seems like we are a behind.  The blog is going to help that by making it easier for us to post information.  Overall is should be  an exciting Fall we have some big plans for the site and lots of new features.  Been working with John Miller on  getting some more of his wonderful  aquatic photography up on the site and  working on allowing everyone to use these for fly tying and informational purposes.    Well here it is the first post I am looking forward to testing the features of this program it is very powerful!

Tight Loops
-Sam
